info.name: Spotify OAuth2.0
info.description:
1. **Set up OAuth 2.0 authentication in Postman for a given API. Walk through the configuration process and any challenges you encountered.**
    

Steps for Setting up OAuth 2.0 in Postman:

1. Register a Developer App by navigating to Spotify Developer Dashboard
    

Create an app and copy Client ID & Client Secret.

1. Set Environment variables for Client ID & Client Secret and provide the values copied in step 1.
    
2. Navigate to the collection in Postman Authorisation Tab
    

Auth Type: OAuth 2.0

Grant Type: Client Credentials

ClientID & Client Secret should be fetched from the environment variables

Client Authentication :Send As Basic Auth Header

Click on Save button.

1. Request Access Token
    

Click on "Get New Access Token"

Authentication complete message will be shown .

Click on Proceed to use the token

âœ… Calling API Endpoints.

You can now make calls to endpoints like:

GET [https://api.spotify.com/v1/search?q=adele&type=artist](https://api.spotify.com/v1/search?q=adele&type=artist)  
Get [https://api.spotify.com/v1/tracks/3KkXRkHbMCARz0aVfEt68P](https://api.spotify.com/v1/tracks/3KkXRkHbMCARz0aVfEt68P)

Challenges with OAUTH2.0:

1.401 Unauthorised error will be thrown when Token is invalid, expired, or missing. Verify that the "Get New Access Token." is working as expected and verify that the correct client id & secret is used. Make sue that the correct Auth URL or Access Token URL are used.

2.Token Not Being Used in Request. After successfully generating a token, it might not be automatically applied to the request.  
After clicking "Use Token" in the "Manage Access Tokens" dialog, ensure that the "Authorization" header in the request is set to Bearer Token and the token value is populated. If not, need to manually select the token from the "Available Tokens" dropdown.
